meta.v: Biblioteca Nacional de Portugal; Fac-simile provided at http://www.purl.pt/17474
Centro de Estudos de Teatro, Universidade de Lisboa
Rebelo, Manoel Coelho. Musa entretenida de vários entremeses. Online edition by José Camões. http://www.cet-e-seiscentos.com

text.title: A musa entretenida de vários entemezes
text.author: Manoel Coelho Rebelo

w.f: mil seiscentos e cinquenta e oito

w.comment: This list is partially different from the one found in the original, because it includes only the plays written in Portuguese.
procurador, recebedor de esmolas para cativos.
frade leigo que cuidava da copa; vagaroso no andar (see CET-UL edition).
'vinte e um', jogo de cartas (black jack) (See CET-UL edition).

Reference to the episode included in chapter 13 of the book of Daniel in the Catholic Bible, according to which Susanna had refused to be blackmailed by two lecherous voyeurs. She was helped by Danniel, who suggested them to be interrogated separately. (See CET-UL edition).
Deturpation from the latin sentence "et Verbum caro factum est" (and the word became flesh) from the Gospel of John 1, 14.
'ele' refers to the "letrado", according to the CET-UL edition.
Diego de Covarrubias y Leiva (1512-1577), o Bártolo espanhol, autor de comentários do Concílio de Trento.
Italics were included to mark direct speech.
decalque do cast. "echar piernas" (jactar-se de corajoso).
Italics included to mark direct speech.
'... que é muito amigo de freiras'...
This sentence continues a previous one, in direct discourse.
'Prima' has multiple meanings; among them, an instrument; 'quebrar prima' means 'desafinar'.
Probably an abbreviation of "por estas barbas" (CET-UL edition).
The line break was originally here.
Before the last "Corpus Crise!" there is the repetition of the character name (Pre.).
The musician was not indicated in the character list.
A line break was included in this point.
The CET-UL edition proposes a colon in this position.
This scene description is not present in the original, but is based in another version.
The original was corrected from another version.
The CET-UL edition keeps a comma in this position.
"Cada um dos filetes de metal que atravessam o ponto dos instrumentos de cordas dedilhadas, para indicar onde o tocador deve pôr os dedos." (Dicionário Priberam)
"Antigo calçado de sola para as mulheres" (CET-UL edition).
To be read as "como se destas", according to the CET-UL edition.
Punctuation included. In the CET-UL edition there is an "e" instead.
Indication of the character is lacking in the original.
'sair: utilizado para indicar entrada em cena' (CET-UL edition).
'outro' cf. edição da Biblioteca Nacional de Portugal.
'a posto que' in the CET-UL edition, whose interpretaion is unclear.
This character is not indicated in the original, but was corrected due to other versions (see CET-UL edition).
